intro: Trichophyllum ravenelii, commonly known as the Florida trichophyllum, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant thrives in moist, sandy soils and is typically found in scrub and sandhill habitats. Its conservation status is critical due to habitat loss and degradation, making it a focus of ecological research and preservation efforts.
